title: Château Simard 2014  Saint-Émilion
description: This is soft, attractive and deliciously fruity. It has soft tannins and lively acidity. With black currants and red-cherry fruits, it is going to be a bright wine that will age relatively quickly. Drink from 2020.

title: Baronet 2011 Familia Reyes Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Dusty earthy cherry and plum aromas are a bit spicy, while this feels blocky, with rubbery tannins. Spicy herbal plum and raspberry flavors show a mild green note on the finish.

title: Bodegas Perica 2015 Olsgosa Viura (Rioja)
description: Warm dusty oaky aromas come prior to a citric palate that's high in acidity and thus austere. Salty citrus flavors are monotone and fail to alter path on a salty woody finish.

title: Bodegas Yuste NV Conde de Aldama Amontillado Palomino (Jerez)
description: This is beautifully bottled and priced for loftiness, but this reviewer finds the wine to be fiery, ultra acidic and just not that pleasurable. Cheesy aromas set up a palate with blazing acidity. That leads to sourness that adorns flavors of salt and peanuts. Despite the fancy packaging, this doesn't come across as anything better than good.

title: Castello di Bossi 2015 Rosato (Toscana)
description: Made of 90% Sangiovese and 10% Cabernet Sauvignon, this offers red berry and Mediterranean herb aromas that carry over to the palate. It closes on a refreshing citrusy note. Enjoy soon.

title: Castello di Poppiano 2014 Il Cortile  (Chianti Colli Fiorentini)
description: Made of 85% Sangiovese and small amounts of Ciliegiolo and Canaiolo, this opens with subtle Morello cherry and underbrush aromas. The palate delivers black plum and tobacco flavors, bolstered by dusty tannins. Enjoy soon.

title: Stolen Identity 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: You'll have to look in the very lower left hand corner of the back label to spot the vintage on this bottle (2014). The soft cherry fruit has a buttery mouthfeel. The wine is lightly toasty and eminently accessible. Drink now through 2020.

title: Joseph Cattin 2015 Sylvaner (Alsace)
description: The nose is very shy and tells little apart from clean freshness. There is a hint of ripe mirabelle fruit on the palate, and lovely, seemingly transparent freshness. This is not really about flavor but about a very light body with a most gentle delicate structure. The finish is clean. Drink soon.

title: Medlock Ames 2014 Lower Slope Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine shows power and ripeness on the palate, with an oaky nuttiness on the nose. Lemony pear and stony minerality combine with a graham cracker creaminess, providing weight and length.

title: Gattavecchi 2012 Riserva dei Padri Serviti  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: Oak, licorice and grilled rosemary aromas lead the nose. The palate offers espresso, toast, dried cherry and sage flavors, pulled taut by close-grained tannins that leave an astringent finish.

title: Girasole 2015 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)
description: A touch of smoke and walnut in the aroma make this wine stand out, while apple and butter flavors fill in the palate. It's medium-bodied, dry and attractive in an Old World, slightly austere style.

title: Domaine Ostertag 2015 Rouge E Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: A slightly funky lift precedes a very crunchy light palate. There is freshness and frank up-front red-cherry fruit along with ample juiciness. This picnic-style wine will benefit from being served chilled.

title: Happy Camper 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This wine combines oaky sweetness with good, plummy fruit flavors and a lightly grippy texture. It's tasty and approachable in style.

title: Heartland 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Langhorne Creek)
description: Aromas of damp earth, cassis and cigar box lead the way in this medium- to full-bodied wine. The flavors mirror the nose for the most part, but add hints of tomato and vanilla as well. Tannins are silky the finish. Drink now–2020.

title: Henschke 2015 Innes Vineyard Pinot Gris (Adelaide Hills)
description: This wine offers an intriguing dichotomy. While the wine offers ample weight and a plump mouthfeel, the flavors seem underdeveloped, offering hints of wet stone, underripe melon and stone fruit, and tart citrus. Aniseed sneaks in on the dusty, tactile finish.

title: Domaines Schlumberger 2015 Les Princes Abbés Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: Very gentle notions of ripe pear color the nose. The palate is more toned down, with an earthy edge. The body is light and fresh. Drink while aromas are at their height.

title: Dominio Basconcillos 2015 Viña Magna 6 Meses en Barrica  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Jumpy berry aromas are offset by notes of clove and wet dog. This feels thick, chewy and creamy, while foxy berry and plum flavors are bolstered by heavy oak. On a creamy feeling finish, a chocolatey note rises up along with herbal hints.

title: Nugan Family Estates 2015 Third Generation Chardonnay (South Eastern Australia)
description: From a warm, inland region, this is nevertheless a fine value. It's rich and full-bodied without being over the top, offering spice-accented notes of peach, apricot and pineapple. Drink now.

title: Robert Hall 2015 Viognier (Paso Robles)
description: Fresh and zesty on the nose, this bottling offers lemongrass, lime peel and kiwi scents, with floral jasmine undertones. The palate delivers loads of zing—an almost effervescent energy and verve—with Bosc pear, apple and honeysuckle flavors.

title: Etablissements Thunevin 2014 Domaine Virginie Thunevin  (Bordeaux)
description: With attractive red fruits and soft acidity, this is a fruity wine. It is ripe with a lively crisp texture. Produced by the daughter of Jean-Luc Thunevin of Saint-Emilion's Château Valandraud, the wine is bright and ready to drink.

title: Monterebro 2015 Blanco Sauvignon Blanc (Jumilla)
description: Jumilla is a red-wine region, but this Sauvignon Blanc is a citrusy example of a tastyquaffable white from the area. Aromas of citrus peel are mildly pyrazinic, while this feels plump and balanced, but with spritz. Core citrus flavors come with a sprinkle of salt.

title: Montespina 2016 Sauvignon (Rueda)
description: White-flower aromas are a touch yeasty, like animal crackers. This feels plump but maintains a sense of freshness. Citrus and nectarine flavors are generic but good, while this is lasting on the finish, with notes of grape-skin extract and pyrazines.

title: Montinore 2015 Borealis The Northern Whites White (Willamette Valley)
description: The so-called Northern Whites are Gewürztraminer, Müller-Thurgau, Pinot Gris and Riesling. They make a comfortable blend, with floral aromas and plump peach and apple fruit. Though finished dry, it has appealing fruit sweetness.

title: Rancho Sisquoc 2014 Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Abundant fresh floral aromas such as violet and lilac show on the nose of this bottling, with black plum and candied grape notes. The palate is straightforward, all tangy plum flavors, enhanced by dried herb, soy and reductive tar notes.

title: River's Edge 2015 Pinot Gris (Elkton Oregon)
description: This was barrel fermented, and picked up a fair amount of oaky flavor as a result. The barrels overtake the light apple fruit, at least for now, but consider this as a fine, inexpensive alternative to Chardonnay.

title: Palma Real 2015 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Crisp aromas of celery and lime set up a fresh citrusy palate that's light to medium in both body and weight. Flavors of green-grape skins and lemon-lime finish a bit salty, but with proper acidity and balance.

title: Palumbo Family Vineyards 2013 50-50 Syrah-Cabernet Sauvignon (Temecula Valley)
description: Incredibly ripe and dried black cherry, strawberry, clove and smoke aromas give this bottling an almost port-like nose. The palate is similar, with prune and raisin touches, with cooked red fruit and baking spice.

title: Styring 2015 Afterglow Dessert Riesling (Ribbon Ridge)
description: Finished at 185 g/L residual sugar, this is produced cryogenically (meaning frozen, then pressed). It's on the sugary side of sweet, with simple flavors of lemon tea and rock candy.

title: Montemercurio 2013 Petaso  (Rosso di Montepulciano)
description: Chopped herb, underbrush, truffle and balsamic notes lead the nose. The palate is fresh, vibrant and polished, offering sour cherry fruit with a hint of licorice. A sage note closes the finish.

title: Montinore 2012 Graham's Block 7 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Tart cranberry and raspberry fruit comes with a touch of caramel coffee. It's medium bodied and should be consumed within the next two or three years.
